posts.author: Kastelholm
posts.content:
1) PvM or PvP:
Focused on PVP but if it can kill a dragon or two solo it would be nice of course.
No rp on this server so all xp comes from hitting things.

2) Level cap:
Max level is 30, softcap is 16 cause after that you get like 2xp per kill.
So aiming for strong at 15 would be good and then every extra level would just be an extra bonus.

3) Race preference:
Dwarf or human preferably.
In worst case half-orc or elf.
As said, looking for massive cheese on a pure pvp server.

4) Class preference:
Anything goes really. Honest.

5) Melee preference:
If melee, the highest damage and survival potential.

6) Range preference:
Server seems to lag quite often so not sure if this is wise.
But anything powerful goes.

7) Weapon preference:
Anything that combined survivability with high dps.
Bastardsword with tower shield maybe? Scythe? 2h sword?

8) Maximum item enhancement:
+3 attributes gear exist. Most people use greater weapon buff +5 rather than upgrading their weapons in damage. There is life steal, elemental damage, haste, stoneskin & invisibility. But most are charged spells that you can use x times per day and they count your casterlevel towards effectiveness.

9) Spellcasting:
Wizards are heavily nerfed so they tend to do buffs and fight melee, damage has been lowered and you need onetime use items to cast.
Clerics are offlimits unless you're a member of their game group.

10) Custom factors:
- The first three levels have to be the same class.
- No cleric, paladin or druid.
- If monk then it has to start there and when switches to another class it locks out monk advancement forever.
- Exotic style weaponry to fit in with my toon. Scythe, doubleblade/mace/axe, katanas and so forth would be nice but aiming for cheese so whatever really.
- Any mix of rogue, mage, ranger, fighter & barbarian allowed.
- Prestige classes assassin, shadowdancer & weaponmaster are free to use. Most others have limitations.
- You can rest 1 time per 30 minutes, so healing is hard and getting back x amount skills/spells is hard.
- Getting killed by a player makes you lose a level, no matter what level you're at. So survival is nice.

Beyond that, massive dps & selfsufficient & destroyer of worlds preferably.

Mainly wanting to prove that said server can still face strong builds even when most classes are locked behind a paywall. (You pay to join their community).

posts.author: Kastelholm
posts.content:
Hm, how about I start with...

Dwarf fighter/dwarven defender/weapon master.
17/ 12/ 16/ 8/ 13/ 6

Dwarven battleaxe, tower shield & full platemail.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Sorry mate, must have missed your first post. Hello!

Oddly enough, my first proper build here was a Dwarven Defender 23/ Fighter 10/ Weapon Master 7. His stats were Str 17 (rising to 34), Dex 13, Con 16, Wis 8, Int 14, Cha 6. The thread is Grim Stonefoot, and you can find him in Hip's ECB Guild Filter if you fancy a look. There are things I'd do differently these days, but he still holds a place in my heart.

Cheers

posts.author: Kastelholm
posts.content:
What would you have done differently today?
I just thought of this build due to MAX DEFENCE + MAX OFFENCE potential. In my simple world.
But I would probably have mixed it as this is a lvl 30 max server. So 10 fighter, mixed dd / wm.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
And that's exactly where I was coming from. But there's a clue in the name "Dwarven Defender". Three letters: E. D. R. Weapon Master really doesn't gel that well once you focus on what DwDs do well. The 3 builds I'd want to emulate if I were to give it another go are Valerfor's reworking of the Dwarven Wall - who is a delight to play; his Unbreakable; and my own re-imagining of Grizzled Dwarflord's Heath Guard (yes, I'm feeling that arrogant about him - others may differ). I'll try to dig out where to find them.

Cheers

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Bugger - Should have said Hearth Guard. Just a spolling mustake. And I should be careful, because the venerated GDL himself has rejoined us (yes, I spotted it). Have a look in the Full Epic forum - Hip brought the original in and gave the link to my attempt at a 1.69 update (it'll either be on the first or second page).

I'll keep looking for the others

Cheers

posts.author: Kastelholm
posts.content:
How about a standard cleric fighter?
10 lvl fighter, 20 cleric.
Start with cleric 'till you get buffs then switch to fighter at around lvl 9 and get 4 levels there.
Then alternate.
Stats - 16 12 14 8 17 8, invest 2 points in wisdom for 19 then rest in strength.

Anyhow, a pure Cleric can't go wrong. If you can mix in a little Fighter and mayhaps some rogue, then all good.
